com.px100systems.data.core

Class Transaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.px100systems.data.core.Transaction

  • public class Transaction
extends java.lang.Object
    Consumer interface with the data cluster: read or write transaction.
    Business logic code should only interact with Transaction instead of DatabaseStorage.
    Transaction is always limited to one tenant. use tenant ID zero for single-tenant systems.
    Author:
    Alex Rogachevsky

    • Method Detail

      • transaction

        public Transaction transaction(java.lang.Integer tenantId)
                        throws DataStorageException
        A rarely used method to create a temporary transaction for another tenant - or for the same one after committing the current one (useful for processing data in smaller batches).
        Parameters:
        tenantId - tenant ID
        Throws:
        DataStorageException

      • getTenantId

        public java.lang.Integer getTenantId()
        Current tenant ID.
        Returns:
        tenant ID for thios transaction.

      • insert

        public void insert(Entity entity)
        Adds the entity to the list of inserts. Idempotent. Sets id.
        Parameters:
        entity - the bean

      • update

        public void update(Entity entity,
                   boolean optimisticCheck)
        Adds the entity to the list of updates. Idempotent.
        Parameters:
        entity - the bean
        optimisticCheck - check if the record has already been updated/deleted at the time of commit

      • update

        public <T> void update(java.lang.Class<T> cls,
                       java.lang.Long id,
                       EntityProcessor<T> processor)
        Process the entity in storage. Useful for in-memory storages to avoid serializing the whole bean and sending it across the network.
        Only sends the required updates (field changes, etc.) to the primary and backup nodes.
        Not supported by traditional databases.
        Some storage providers like Hazelcast do not support them inside transactions, so those updates are executed first and then rolled back manually.
        Type Parameters:
        T - bean class
        Parameters:
        cls - bean class
        id - entity ID
        processor - entry processor callback/lambda to do something with the bean

      • deleteWithDependents

        public void deleteWithDependents(Entity entity)
        Adds the entity to the list of deletes. Also executes teh cascadeDelete(0 method to delete any dependent entitites (children, etc.). Overwrite Entity.cascadeDelete() when needed.
        Parameters:
        entity - the bean

      • find

        public <T extends StoredBean> java.util.List<T> find(java.lang.Class<T> entityClass,
                                                     Criteria criteria,
                                                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> orderBy,
                                                     java.lang.Integer limit)
        Criteria-based search with limit.
        There are no "joins" of different entities - all such queries should be done inside the loop manually. Joins are generally rare with good NoSQL design.
        Type Parameters:
        T - bean class
        Parameters:
        entityClass - bean class
        criteria - search criteria
        orderBy - - an optional list of SQL-like ORDER BY strings e.g. {"field1 ASC", "field2 DESC", "field3"}
        limit - mandatory list limit
        Returns:
        the list of beans

      • find

        public <T extends StoredBean> EntityCursor<T> find(java.lang.Class<T> entityClass,
                                                   Criteria criteria,
                                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> orderBy)
        Criteria-based search without limit.
        There are no "joins" of different entities - all such queries should be done inside the loop manually. Joins are generally rare with good NoSQL design.
        Type Parameters:
        T - bean class
        Parameters:
        entityClass - bean class
        criteria - search criteria
        orderBy - - an optional list of SQL-like ORDER BY strings e.g. {"field1 ASC", "field2 DESC", "field3"}
        Returns:
        a closeable cursor (always use try/finally to close)

      • commit

        public boolean commit()
               throws DataStorageException
        Transaction commit. Does nothing if there are no data changes.
        Returns:
        if the transaction was committed or not due to the database being inactive.
        Throws:
        DataStorageException
